result.execSummary:
All charges against Jacob Dean Esser in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob Dean Esser is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Dean Esser

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Judge Dreyfus acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person.  Atty Robert Lebell appeared via Zoom.  VRC.  Case is resolved.  State moves to dismiss the criminal case.  Ordinance citation for DC to be efiled.  Deft pleads guilty to the ordinance; found guilty by the Court.  Bond to be applied.  Balance due 10/1/22.  In default, suspension of DL.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Adjustment Number: 22A 179179,
Payable Number: 339358,
Receipt Number: 22R 008979,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued Posted.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Marrelina B, Pamela A-G.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's M.B. residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

326PM   Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered by the court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:10 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. $150  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
and witness list filed by the State
